questions.text: Newton's Third Law is frequently stated as...

answerChoices.text: For every action there is an equal and opposite reaction
An object in motion remains in motion unless acted upon by a net outside force.
Force is equal to mass times acceleration.
All objects with mass are attracted to all other objects with mass.

questions.text: A baseball player swings his bat and exerts a force of 400 Newtons to the right on the ball.  Which of the following is the force that the ball exerts on the bat?

answerChoices.text: The ball exerts no force on the bat.

questions.text: Once upon a time in space, giant aliens built a ship larger than an aircraft carrier. Tiny aliens built a ship smaller than a toy car. Inadvertently, flying between planets, the two ships collide. Which of the following statements is true?

answerChoices.text: Both spaceships exert the same force on each other.
The large spaceship exerts more force on the tiny spaceship than the tiny spaceship exerts on the large spaceship.
The tiny spaceship exerts more force on the large spaceship than the large spaceship exerts on the tiny spaceship.
The large spaceship exerts a force on the tiny spaceship, but the tiny spaceship exerts no force on the large spaceship.
The tiny spaceship exerts a force on the large spaceship, but the large spaceship exerts no force on the tiny spaceship.
Neither spaceship exerts any force on the other.
